JOHN GALEN HOWARD
ARCHITECT
ATLAS BUILDING
604 MISSION STREET
SAN FRANCISCO JOHN GALEN HOWARD _____ WILLIAM OTIS RAIGUEL
div1.p: Let me thank you very sincerely for your capital review of my Brunelleschi — you say such good things of it that of course I am mightily pleased, and very likely the things that are not so pleasant are quite as "good". This going into print is a parlous business. After writng verse all my life and keeping it mostly to myself (where it belonged) I make a tardy debut before the public because these things must be said aloud.

I must say that my opinion of the competency of critics has not, on the whole, been raised by the notices of my old boy. But your lines have raised it, and not merely because you have been kind. You have been, and you have not been afraid to say so, something of what I am driving at, which is this, — to isolate and to portray the artist. I'm not talking of temperament but of constitution. In Brunelleschi, you have, if you have anything, an architect, pure and simple, — mind, heart, soul. Now I am working further afield, and I shall want your criticism. I shall value it. I wish you would let me know where you hang out. I'd like to shake your hand, and I often go east. Perhaps, too, you sometimes cross the Sierras. The bulliest thing about publishing is but that someone out there in the dark has heard your call.

ab.hi:
JOHN GALEN HOWARD
604 MISSION STREET
SAN FRANCISCO
